â•‘           JoJudge - C++ Problem Judger                       â•‘
â•‘                   Quick Start Guide                          â•‘
â•šâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

ğŸ“Œ WHAT IS THIS?
   An automatic grading tool for C++ programming problems.
   No installation needed - just run judge.exe!

ğŸ¯ PROBLEMS AVAILABLE:
   
   Problem 1: Holiday Of Equality
   â€¢ Find minimum cost to equalize citizen welfare
   â€¢ Input: n, then n integers
   â€¢ Output: single integer (minimum cost)
   
   Problem 2: Odd Set
   â€¢ Check if numbers can be paired with odd sums
   â€¢ Input: t, then for each test: n and 2n integers
   â€¢ Output: "Yes" or "No" for each test
   
   Problem 3: Plus or Minus
   â€¢ Determine if a+b=c or a-b=c
   â€¢ Input: t, then for each test: a, b, c
   â€¢ Output: "+" or "-" for each test

âš¡ HOW TO USE:

   1. Write your solution in a .cpp file
   2. Double-click judge.exe
   3. Type problem number (1, 2, or 3) and press Enter
   4. Type full path to your .cpp file, for example:
      C:\Users\YourName\Desktop\solution.cpp
   5. Press Enter and wait for results!

âœ… WHAT TO EXPECT:

   The judger will:
   â€¢ Compile your code
   â€¢ Run it against multiple test cases
   â€¢ Show which tests passed/failed
   â€¢ If failed, show your output vs expected output

ğŸ’¡ TIPS:

   âœ“ Save your file before running the judger
   âœ“ Use the exact file path (copy-paste recommended)
   âœ“ Check output format carefully (spaces, newlines)
   âœ“ Read problem description for input/output format

âš ï¸ COMMON MISTAKES:

   âœ— Wrong file path â†’ "File not found"
   âœ— Syntax errors â†’ "Compilation failed"  
   âœ— Wrong output format â†’ Tests fail
   âœ— Missing endl or \n â†’ Output comparison fails

ğŸ“ FILES IN THIS FOLDER:

   judge.exe           - The judger (run this!)
   mingw64/            - C++ compiler (used automatically)
   *.dll               - Required libraries
   README.txt          - Detailed instructions
   QUICK_START.txt     - This file

ğŸ”§ NEED HELP?

   If compilation fails:
   â†’ Check compile_errors.txt in this folder
   
   If tests fail:
   â†’ Compare "Your Output" with "Expected Output"
   â†’ Check for extra/missing spaces or newlines
   
   If nothing works:
   â†’ Make sure all files are in the same folder
   â†’ Try running from Command Prompt for error details

              Ready to test? Run judge.exe now!
